column4: I am having an issue getting my old compaq persario laptop to work wirelessly.  I hooked it up to the cat5 in order to install the propriatary driver it offered...but it still does not work.  The unit has a button to engage the wireless...and it is not functioning
enable it in windows then reboot to ubuntu
see "/msg ubottu tab", typing z - y - k - o - t - i - c - k - 9 is a MAJOR pain, you don't have to.  FYI you didn't even highlight me ;)
but no suggestions or wireless no.
actually use "tab" "tab" until you get the nick you want.  or "zyk<tab>" type thing.
So, no more information on wireless?
so does N-M see network now?
It just will not allow me to see the wireless connections.  I tried rebooting back into windows and enabling it...which got the blue light going when i came back...but still no wireless.
what card is it try "lspci | grep -i wireless" and/or "lspci | grep -i network" and paste ONLY your wireless hardware, should be 1 line.
using an earlier version of ubuntu and hardware working, now it doesn't.
use lsusb if above doesn't work.
06:02.0 Network controller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4318 [AirForce One 54g] 802.11g Wireless LAN Controller (rev 02)
